titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1120) to prohibit the National Labor Relations Board from taking any action that requires a quorum of the members of the Board until such time as Board constituting a quorum shall have been confirmed by the Senate, the Supreme Court issues a decision on the constitutionality of the appointments to the Board made in January 2012, or the adjournment sine die of the first session of the 113th Congress.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-32, by Ms. Foxx.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1120 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
The resolution provides that an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of the Rules Committee Print 113-6 shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 15.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 146.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 192 (Roll no. 97).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 194 (Roll no. 98).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/10/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1120) to prohibit the National Labor Relations Board from taking any action that requires a quorum of the members of the Board until such time as Board constituting a quorum shall have been confirmed by the Senate, the Supreme Court issues a decision on the constitutionality of the appointments to the Board made in January 2012, or the adjournment sine die of the first session of the 113th Congress.
